item.title: Lies of P DLC Release Window Narrowed Down
item.description:
Highlights

  • Lies of P DLC is still on track for 2nd half 2024 release, per a recent earnings report from Neowiz.
  • Neowiz remains committed to Lies of P franchise.
  • Sequel details are still under wraps.

Recently revealed Lies of P information from its developer and publisher has shed more light on the release window for the game's upcoming DLC expansion. While Lies of P fans are eager to see more content added to the game, they will likely have at least a few more months before they receive it.

The Soulslike retelling of the classic Pinocchio tale was a surprise hit in September 2023, generally well-received by both professional critics and fans when it made its debut. Less than two months after the game's release, game director Choi Ji-won revealed in a Director's Letter video on YouTube that a Lies of P DLC expansion was already in the works, and that it was the top priority for the development team. However, details about the DLC, including its release date, were not given at that time.

Related
All Lies of P Cut Content Explained

Lies of P's enthralling fantasy world was once a bit bigger, as developers Neowiz and Round 8 Studios had to cut some content from the game.

Recently, though, publisher/developer Neowiz released its 2024 first-quarter earnings results report, which reveals a little more information that helps narrow down when the DLC may arrive. Under the report's "New Pipleline" section, six different projects are listed, including the Lies of P DLC. With the exception of the mobile game Pro Soccer: Legends Eleven , which is listed in the report with a release date of May 8 and is already available on the market, all other projects are simply listed with the broad release window of "2nd Half 2024," meaning it will likely be at least a few more months before players find more to do in Lies of P . Still, pending any delays, the DLC should arrive before the end of the 2024 fiscal year.

More Information About Lies of P's DLC and Sequel

Lies of P has been the top hit from Neowiz Games, and the earnings report shows the publisher/developer's commitment to the fairytale-inspried Soulslike . While the company's overall operating costs have decreased over the past two quarters, labor costs have climbed by 24.8 percent year-over-year, and the report specifically mentions Lies of P in that section. The only other direct mention of the game is in the quarterly revenue breakdown, which mentions decreased stabilization of revenue coming from Lies of P , though that's to be expected for most games in the months following their launch.

The report makes no mention of the game's announced sequel, so fans hoping to see it revealed soon are unlikely to receive their wish. Early reports seem to indicate that the sequel will expand outside the realm of Pinocchio into other fairy tales, and with Lies of P 's visuals and stylistic choices being some of its most praised aspects, the reported implementation of Unreal Engine 5 could be a huge upgrade for Lies of P 2 .

item.title: Call of Duty 2024 May Have an Unexpected Title
item.description:
Highlights

  • Black Ops 6 may be the surprise title for the next Call of Duty game, deviating from previous rumors.
  • The Black Ops series has been popular since 2010.
  • Reports suggest Black Ops 6 will be a day one Xbox Game Pass game.

The title for the next Call of Duty may be something completely unexpected, as recent rumors are now suggesting that the next game's name will be Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . The continuation of the Black Ops series has been highly anticipated by Call of Duty fans.

The Black Ops games have been an ongoing sub-series in the Call of Duty franchise since 2010, and each game has explored an interesting look at undercover, off-the-books operations during war. 2020's addition of Black Ops Cold War brought even more espionage and action to the series, but rumors about what could be next for the Black Ops spin-offs have been circulating for a while now. One of the biggest prevailing theories has been that the next game will be called Black Ops Gulf War , but recent claims state otherwise.

Related
Rumor: Call of Duty Black Ops Gulf War Launch Weapons List Leaks Online

A new leak claims to reveal the launch weapons for Call of Duty 2024, which is rumored to take place in the early 1990s during the Gulf War.

A new rumor making its rounds on the internet is claiming that the next Black Ops game will actually be called Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . For months, many have been led to believe that Black Ops would be named after the Gulf War, the possible setting for the game, but these new rumors imply that the series is returning to form with its numbered titles. After a classic Black Ops weapon was recently discovered in Warzone , the next chapter in the spin-off series may be gearing up for an official reveal.

Next Call of Duty Game May Be Called Black Ops 6

Not only has the game's title potentially been leaked, but there are also rumors that the next Black Ops could be scheduled for release on October 25 of this year. There are even claims that the upcoming Black Ops title will be a day one release for Xbox Game Pass , Microsoft's popular game subscription service. With the upcoming Xbox Showcase scheduled for next month, it would present the perfect time to officially reveal the title and release date in order to finally know if these current rumors are true or not.

Black Ops developer Treyarch has been leaving cryptic messages on Twitter that many believe to be hinting at an upcoming reveal of Black Ops 6 .

Although it was expected that the next Black Ops would be named after the real-life conflict it is predicted to feature, it seems as though developer Treyarch may be taking a different route. Hopefully, there will be official answers given on June 9 during the Xbox Showcase. Whatever the next Black Ops game happens to be called, it will be exciting to see what's next in store for the series.

item.title: May 23 is Going to Be a Huge Day for Roblox
item.description:
Highlights

  • Roblox players are excited for "The Classic" event on May 23, bringing back nostalgic games and cosmetics from the platform's early days.
  • Games like "Adopt Me!", "Bed Wars," and "Zombie Rush" will revert to classic designs for the event, sparking interest among players.
  • The event aims to attract more players to Roblox, following a trend of games bringing back older content to engage their communities.

Roblox players are gearing up for a historic day later this month as the online game platform prepares to "go classic" on May 23, promising a return to a highly-beloved and deeply nostalgic era for the title. The date marks the official start of Roblox 's "The Classic" event, which is set to bring back a variety of games, cosmetics and activities from the platform's early days as part of a community-wide celebration of the game's history.

A variety of classic games like "Adopt Me!" , "Bed Wars," and "Zombie Rush" have recently changed their logos to their original looks, implying that they will be participating in the event by reverting to some of their classic design schemes and formulas. There is no official list of participating games as yet, but the ones that do participate will seemingly be bringing back some of their oldest content, though it is unclear if the games as a whole are changing or simply adding the content as an optional add-on.

Related
25 Best Roblox Games That Let You Make Your Own Choices

Players who enjoy making weighty decisions in video games should take a look at these titles on Roblox.

What Does "The Classic" Event Mean for Roblox?

The official Roblox account on Twitter announced the event with a video showing some of the platform's most popular classic items like a "Cheezburger" hat, a rubber duck, and several other cosmetic items. While the planned duration of the event is still unknown as of the time of this writing, previous events tended to span about two weeks, so fans are speculating "The Classic" may last just as long. The Classic Event will go live in Roblox starting May 23 .

Roblox is just one of a string of games bringing back their older content in an effort to drum up more players, with the most obvious recent example being the return of the original map and weapons in Fortnite 's recent "OG season. Even before that, Blizzard conceded its OG players as well with the release of World of Warcraft Classic, which serves as a legacy server for fans who wish to play the game's older content as if it is new once again, with the original expansions coming out again one at a time.

Roblox has evolved a lot since its release back in 2006, having gone from a simple platform for creative players to make their own games to a full-blown corporation with official brand partners and professionally-made games. The platform has even partnered with other companies to produce official tie-in games for various franchises like anime, video games, and science fiction , all hailing from a variety of genres.

The platform has also seen its share of controversies, as its free-to-play model encourages heavy monetization for many of its games, for which children make up a large chunk of their audience. Still, Roblox continues to go strong, boasting millions of players, though the company is reportedly facing an economic downturn that may explain the arrival of events such as "The Classic" to attract more players to the platform.

item.title: Rumor: Total War Star Wars Game in Development at Creative Assembly
item.description:
Highlights

  • Creative Assembly may be working on a Star Wars-themed Total War game.
  • Recent Total War entries faced backlash, prompting the developer to promise improvements for future titles.
  • Fans may expect a Total War: Star Wars game in the next few years.

Recent rumors suggest that famed RTS developer Creative Assembly may currently be working on a new Total War game set in the Star Wars universe, alongside two other projects. With the latest installments in the series being met with some controversy among fans, a Star Wars -themed Total War game could be just what Creative Assembly needs to revitalize interest in the franchise and capture a more mainstream audience.

The Total War series has served as a major pillar of the RTS genre throughout its 24-year-run, though it has experienced a number of ups and downs over the decades. The most recent entry in the franchise, 2023's Total War : Phara oh , for instance, launched to largely mixed reception from both fans and critics. 2022's Total War: Warhammer 3 , meanwhile, was criticized by players for its expensive DLC and expansions, which many claimed didn't offer enough content to justify their price tags. Backlash was so strong, in fact, that Creative Assembly apologized to the community for the missteps, vowing to improve future titles in the Total War franchise going forward. As for what one of these upcoming Total War games could be, it seems like fans may now have a clearer picture of what to expect.

Related
12 Games To Play If You Love Total War: Warhammer

For players looking for an experience similar to Total War: Warhammer, here are some games to check out.

According to a new report from DualShockers , Creative Assembly is allegedly developing "a total of three new Total War games," one of which is said to be "an officially licensed Star Wars game." It is claimed that this rumored Total War: Star Wars entry is the second of the three aforementioned titles currently in development, "as of October 2023." However, DualShockers was unable to determine which of these upcoming games is closest to release. The wording here, though, does seem to suggest that Total War: Star Wars could be launched within the next few years.

A Total War Game Set in the Star Wars Universe Could Be a Refreshing Take on the RTS Franchise

Since the release of Total War: Attila in 2015, Creative Assembly's celebrated action RTS franchise has received a new installment almost every year, except for in 2021. Based off of the developer's annual release cadence, it's possible that these three upcoming titles will be released over the next three years, assuming that there's another Total War game set to launch in 2024. Since Total War : Star Wars is apparently the second of the three titles in development, then perhaps it could be released in 2025 if it's been in the works for enough time.

The proposition of a crossover between these two beloved franchises will likely excite both Total War fans and Star Wars enthusiasts alike. If this game truly is in development, then it might just be the ace up Creative Assembly's sleeve that it may use to propel the Total War series to new levels of popularity and success. Even if this rumored Total War: Star Wars title doesn't exist, fans will at least be pleased to know that Jedi: Survivor developer Respawn Entertainment is making a Star Wars strategy game of its own. So, nonetheless, it seems like gamers will be getting a Star Wars -themed title in the strategy genre no matter what, whether it's part of the Total War franchise or not.

item.title: Fae Farm Developer Hit With Layoffs
item.description:
Highlights

  • Layoffs hit Phoenix Labs, with 140 staff cut and projects canceled.
  • Fae Farm developer faces uncertain future as layoffs and restructuring plague gaming studios in 2024.
  • Audiences are skeptical of corporate decisions as layoffs rock big names in the video game industry.

Continuing layoffs in the video game industry have now struck Fae Farm developer Phoenix Labs, with approximately 140 staff members facing termination and multiple in-development games getting axed. Last year's unfortunate trend of major gaming studio layoffs has carried over into 2024, and audiences remain uncertain of the future of the industry, as both AAA and indie studios have been plagued by "restructuring."

Released in 2023, Fae Farm is a 3D farming life-sim with magical RPG elements and has been compared to the likes of Stardew Valley , Animal Crossing , and Disney Dreamlight Valley . The game's developer, Phoenix Labs, also worked on Dauntless , a free-to-play action RPG published by Epic Games. In spite of both games proving popular and growing dedicated player bases, Phoenix Labs has suddenly announced major cutbacks in its workforce and development projects.

Related
Square Enix Reportedly Plans Layoffs Across US, EU Offices

US and EU-based employees of Square Enix may be laid off soon, possibly writing the next chapter of the prolonged game industry layoffs saga.

First revealed by insiders and employees on May 16, Phoenix Labs is expected to let go of roughly 140 staff members, specifically axing those working on any and all projects outside of Fae Farm and Dauntless . According to a series of LinkedIn posts from Phoenix Labs developer Noah Watkins , a new game he and others had been working on for over five years has now been canceled and many of its development team laid off. He notes that this latest string of cutbacks is in addition to another recent round of layoffs, resulting in approximately 200 total layoffs at Phoenix Labs within the past few months. Phoenix Labs has stated that the layoffs are part of a "restructuring" process that aims to ensure a sustainable business in the long-run and will place full development and employment priority on future additions to Fae Farm and Dauntless .

Layoffs Continue To Bombard The Video Game Industry

From major AAA brands to smaller indie studios, the video game industry has seen layoffs, cutbacks, and cancelations popping up left and right for almost a year straight. Top companies like Microsoft, Embracer Group, Sony, Sega, and even Insomniac announced staff layoffs , with many leaders pointing to "restructuring" as a necessary move to ensure corporate sustainability. However, audiences have remained tentatively skeptical and openly critical of the decisions by CEOs to ax hundreds of employees for seemingly short-term gains. Many have pointed to record profits and rising executive salaries in counterarguments against the alleged necessity of the cutbacks. As tensions continue to grow between companies and their workers and consumers, fans remain worried about the tumultuous conditions of the gaming industry.

Companies across industries continue to struggle to find a balance between wavering economic conditions and internal procedures, with many resorting to major layoffs and cutbacks to satisfy investors and shareholders. With audiences remaining uneasy in the face of almost constant layoffs and cancelations in the video game industry, it will be interesting to see if Phoenix Labs will be able to bounce back and achieve its desired future for Fae Farm and Dauntless .
